topPRs.title: docs: add note about L2 vs L1 finality on Optimism
topPRs.author: stalim17
topPRs.body:
This PR adds a short note to the README clarifying the distinction between
UX-level finality on L2 and economic finality on L1.

While transactions can be treated as final for user experience once they are
included in an L2 block, economic finality is only achieved after the
corresponding state root has been posted and finalized on L1.

This helps developers set correct expectations when building on Optimism.
Documentation-only change, no code modifications.

topContributors.summary: sbvegan: Primarily focused on documentation improvements, merging a substantial refactor in ethereum-optimism/docs#1870 (+728/-394 lines) which involved modifying 147 files and contributed to 86% of their other work, demonstrating a clear focus on documentation.

stalim17: Today, stalim17 opened a documentation-focused pull request, ethereum-optimism/docs#1871, adding a note about L2 vs L1 finality on Optimism, which involved modifying 1 file with 3 lines of additions.
opgitgovernance: Merged a configuration update in the superchain-registry via PR #1156, indicating a focus on routine maintenance and automated processes.

JosepBove: Today, JosepBove initiated feature work by opening PR #18300 in ethereum-optimism/optimism to add a safer safes audit, modifying 2 files with a single commit primarily focused on documentation.

janjakubnanista: Today, janjakubnanista created an issue in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#18301) to research alternatives for safer mise installation, indicating a focus on security improvements. Their code changes involved a single commit with minor modifications across various file types, primarily focused on bugfix work.
